title.narrative: Even it Up Campaign in Vietnam Phase 2

description.narrative:
Inequality is the central to Oxfam#s mission to fight poverty. Vietnam is one of more than 40 countries where Oxfam is developing anational inequality campaign. The inequality campaign in Vietnam runss from 2016 to 2019. The four-year campaign focuses on promoting public debates on the need to combat extreme inequalities, raising public awareness of the issue, enhancing the roles of CSOs in addressing inequalities and contributing to discussions and the progressive changes policies that address inequalities. The long-term goal of the campaign is that by 2019 there will be improvement on policy development/execution (or legislative change/policy change) to fight inequality and more effective re-distributive measures to address poverty and gender injustice. This will be backed up by solid evidences that extreme inequality is wrong, and stands in the way of people claiming their rights.
The 1st phase of the EiU campaign in Vietnam (2016-2018) has conducted several studies on inequality in Vietnam as well as people's perception on this issues. These studies have provided important input to campaign activities which have succeeded in increasing people's awareness on thegeneral concept of inequality and the need to tackle it. This next phase (2018-2019)of the campaign will specify the issue of inequality so that citizens can feel its relevance, practise the values of equality as well as advocate for the changes in policies that will solve the causes of inequality and sustainable reduce the gap between the richest and poorest group. This phase aims to create a discourse on inequality in the society and bring solving inequality into the government's agenda.
Oxfam is seeking to make the progress on three areas towards meeting this goal which are as follows:
- Shifting the debates and creating the new discourse amongthe policy makers, media and citizen to make greater change possible from now until 2019. The debate will include the increasing gap between the rich and the poor, state budget mobilisation through the fair fiscal system with the focus on women and girls, labors'rights - Inspire youth led campaign groups and CSOs to pay attention to inequality and support to enhance their roles in addressing inequality in public - Policy progress about the inequality in accessing quality social services (health) through more transparentand accountable information sharing mechanisms about state budget mobilisation and allocation to social services.
Expected outcomes: - A comprehensive campaign strategy to direct the communication activities in 2018 and 2019 - An established equality coalition empowered to promote equality values and changes in policies to tackle inequality. - Discourse on inequality/equality becomes common in social debates, academic sphere and political space.
This campaign will work closely with other stakeholders within the Financing for Development Programme such as BTAP, M.net, Tax Justice Alliance to make greater impact.

participating-org.narrative: ECUE was founded in January 2018 as a social enterprise which promotes sustainable production and consumption through promoting ethics in business and protecting consumer#s rights. ECUE works with non-governmental organizations, enterprises and governmental agencies to address issues of environmental pollution, gender injustice, labor rights violation, LGBTIQ discrimination, integrity and community rights. ECUE focuses on research and social campaigns to encourage consumers and citizen to care about equality and justice. ECUE aims to organize consumer-citizens to better exercise their rights to influence both enterprises and state agencies to respect human rights in business. ECUE advises responsible companies on sustainability and designs communicationproducts for them which convey their commitments to public goods. ECUE has a working relationship with Oxfam Novib on BTAP (Budget Transparency and Accountability Partnership) and ECUE#s founder is the Chairperson of People#s Participation Working Group(PPWG) which Oxfam Novib is also a coremember.
